content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 10 ยง 442.20 - Accounting for pledges

State Regulations
[ 1410 ]
All pledges, less a provision for
amounts estimated to be uncollectible, must be included in the hospitalapos;s
accounting records. If unrestricted, they must be recorded as nonoperating
revenue in the period the pledge is made. If part of the pledge is to be
applied during some future period, that part must be recorded in the period the
pledge is received as deferred revenue. If restricted, they must be recorded as
an addition to the appropriate restricted fund balance. See Hospital Audit
